Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/takeOneFrom

Function tuple[&T, set[&T]] takeOneFrom(set[&T] s)
Description Remove an arbitrary element from set s and return a tuple consisting of the element and the modified set.
Examples 
rascal>import Set;
ok
rascal>takeOneFrom({1, 2, 3, 4});
tuple[int,set[int]]: <4,{3,2,1}>
rascal>takeOneFrom({1, 2, 3, 4});
tuple[int,set[int]]: <3,{4,2,1}>
rascal>takeOneFrom({1, 2, 3, 4});
tuple[int,set[int]]: <1,{4,3,2}>
[Edit] | [New] | [Compile Course] | [Warnings]
